patient_details.name: piyush
patient_details.symptoms: Hematuria, Proteinuria, Edema, High blood pressure, Flank pain, Lower back pain, Fatigue, Changes in urine color, Uremia, Nausea, Vomiting, Loss of appetite
patient_details.medications: yes for headache, loss of appetite

top_rare_diseases.long_description: Alport Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Alport Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder that affects the type IV collagen in the body, leading to kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Alport Syndrome can lead to end-stage renal disease, hearing loss, and vision impairment if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations in the COL4A3, COL4A4, or COL4A5 genes
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Genetic testing, kidney biopsy, hearing tests, and eye exams
top_rare_diseases.treatment: Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors, angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs), and kidney transplantation

top_rare_diseases.long_description: FSGS is a rare kidney disease characterized by scarring of the glomeruli, leading to proteinuria and kidney failure.
top_rare_diseases.overview: FSGS is a rare kidney disease that affects the glomeruli, leading to proteinuria and kidney failure.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: FSGS can lead to end-stage renal disease if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations, infections, and immune system disorders
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Kidney biopsy, blood tests, and urine tests

top_rare_diseases.long_description: MPGN is a rare kidney disease characterized by inflammation and scarring of the glomeruli, leading to proteinuria and kidney failure.

top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: MPGN can lead to end-stage renal disease if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Infections, immune system disorders, and genetic mutations
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Kidney biopsy, blood tests, and urine tests
